name: LBJ Memorial Grove on the Potomac
description: From this distance the seat of national power appears pristine across the river, so President Johnson came here often when he needed to escape from the stresses of building a Great Society. After he died, his wife chose this place for his memorial. A landscape of serpentine paths, white pines, a granite monolith, and an open meadow honors his legacy of social justice and conservation legislation.
shortDescription: From this distance the seat of national power appears pristine across the river, so President Johnson came here often when he needed to escape from the stresses of building a Great Society. After he d...

operatingHours.description: Open year round from 6 AM to 10 PM

climate.weatherDescription: Summers in the park are generally hot and humid, with daytime highs frequently above 90 degrees Fahrenheit and scattered afternoon thunderstorms. Please carry water while participating in physical activity and be prepared to take shelter from lightning. Winters in the park are generally cold, with nighttime lows frequently near freezing and occasional snowfall. Please be alert for snowplows and icy spots on roadways. Weather during spring and fall is generally moderate, but can change quickly.

images.title: The Lyndon Baines Johnson Memorial Grove on the Potomac
images.caption: The Memorial mirrors the Washington Monument across the River in Washington D.C.

images.title: Lyndon Baines Johnson Memorial Grove
images.caption: The grove come to life with blooming flowers in the Spring.

images.title: Birds at Lyndon Baines Johnson Memorial Grove on the Potomac
images.caption: Lyndon Baines Johnson came to this location many times to pause and reflect.

images.caption: The LBJ memorial with DC in the distance.

images.title: Daffodils near the LBJ Memorial

images.caption: View of the Memorial Bridge and Potomac River from near the LBJ Memorial Grove.
